settings.title: Beard Growth
settings.subtitle: Beard growth treatments can provide substantial results with consistent use. Find our range of beard growth treatments and tools below.

settings.title: Why is my beard patchy?
settings.text: Beards can become patchy due to factors such as age, genetics, hormonal imbalances and the onset of alopecia. Beard hair also does not suddenly stop growing, instead genetic influences dictate the rate of growth from the hair follicles. It is also recommended to wash your beard thoroughly twice a week so the pores do not clog and natural oils remain intact.

settings.title: How long does it take to see results?
settings.text: From the initial and continued use of beard growth treatment results can show new, increased and denser appearance of hair. Treatment must be carried out on a regular basis, over a period of months and maintained thereafter.

settings.title: How do beard treatments work?
settings.text: Beard treatments work by stimulating hair follicles.

settings.title: Can people with hair loss still grow beards?
settings.text: Hair loss and facial hair loss are unrelated as they are both impacted by different hormones. Hair loss stemming from the head is sensitive to dihydrotestosterone (DHT). DHT is produced by testosterone, therefore when hormones are imbalanced and testosterone levels are low, men experience hair loss but are still capable of growing facial hair.

settings.title: At what age should a beard be at its fullest?
settings.text: Mens beards begin growing during puberty between the ages of 11 and 14. The rate of hair growth reduces as age increases.

settings.title: Why is my beard dry and coarse?
settings.text: It is important to clean your beard thoroughly only once or twice a week, so natural oils can nourish the facial hair whilst pores are regularly unclogged.

settings.text: An online consultation checks if you are eligible to purchase the product.
